list_definition.definition: to feel uncertain about, but inclined not to believe

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I doubt if he’ll come now
He might have a screwdriver, but I doubt it.

list_definition.definition: not to be sure of the reliability of
a feeling of not being sure and sometimes of being suspicious

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: There is some doubt as to what happened
I have doubts about that man.

There is no doubt that such a proposal will be ver y popular here at home.
He did, and there is no doubt that viewed from 2006, his work suffered accordingly.
No doubt there will be debates about how far determinacy will take us.
No detailed explanation was given as to how these dramatic increases in performance were to be achieved, and many observers doubted that they could be.
There is no doubt that greater thought and energy are directed towards the first objective.
This is no doubt related to the increased interest in gas centrifuges as a means of separating uranium isotopes.
